subject: Re: one time setUp and tearDown
msgSnippet: Thank you Vladimir.  I was about to try something similar, but I didn t think to then pass the suite() method to TestRunner.run(). Then to prevent my
messageBody:
Thank you Vladimir. I was about to try something similar, but I
didn't think to then pass the suite() method to TestRunner.run().

Then to prevent my oneTimeSetUp() and oneTimeTearDown() methods from
getting bloated, I just kept the methods by the same name in
TestDBMaps and TestLookup and called them from the methods defined
in the anonymous class.

Thanks again!
Curt

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Vladimir R. Bossicard"
<vladimir@b...> wrote:
> > public static void main(String[] args)
> > {
> > junit.textui.TestRunner.run(suite());
> > }
> >
> > public static Test suite()
> > {
> > TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> >
> > suite.addTestSuite(TestLookup.class);
> > suite.addTestSuite(TestDBMaps.class);
> >
> > TestSetup wrapper = new TestSetup(suite)
> > {
> > protected void setUp()
> > {
> > oneTimeSetUp();
> > }
> >
> > protected void tearDown()
> > {
> > oneTimeTearDown();
> > }
> > };
> > return wrapper;
> > }
>
> should solve your problem
>
> -Vladimir
>
> --
> Vladimir R. Bossicard
> www.bossicard.com
